meanings.definition: To take (something, especially money) dishonestly for one's own use.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky thief was caught peculating money from the cash register.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt official was arrested for peculating funds from the government.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was peculating snacks from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The greedy character in the story was always peculating treasures from others.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox was peculating eggs from the henhouse every night.

meanings.sent1: The cunning con artist was peculating funds from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: The embezzler was sentenced to prison for peculating company funds.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten was caught peculating treats from the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the night was peculating secrets from the enemy camp.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain was known for peculating treasures from rival ships.
